entry.title: Replay Party • Nuke play
entry.content:
Nukes work well in a few places.

A) Mineral Line
B) Supply Groupings
C) At an army

A)-A good nuke will kill EVERY last one of their workers-and even if they pull away, they'll be losing a ton of income.
B)-Being Supply blocked is a good way to kill a build order or fail at a game. Being supply blocked is a fear everyone should have. If you're opponent is foolish enough to simply stack all of their pylons/depots/ovies, in a single place-then a nuke there will kill a few thousand minerals, have them waste some more, and not be able to make units for a long while, and in a Terran's case or Zerg, a loss of income due to lack of workers.
C)-Armies are always fun to nuke. Use a nuke to deny an area (away from your expansion, mayhaps?), or if they don't move, crush the army. If your ghost is well hidden-they may not move because they think it's at their mineral line.

Nukes are fun. But be warned not to overuse/depend on them. It gets harder and harder to nuke as you move up the leagues.

They're also a great tool in team games.

entry.title: Starcraft II Strategies • My PvT Strat.
entry.content:
ClusterBomb wrote:

This is better than a normal 4 gate because stalkers get there butt's kicked to terran MM with a wall.
Sure you could "try" and scout past the wall and if they dont have anything you can just 4 gate. Either way though I seem to win PvT much more when I do my build. (also it's just more fun)

I have won so many games recently vs T with heavy stalker armies vs a wall in. 3gate robo with a obs, 4gate with hallucination or void ray if they where stupid enough to actually wall in. You can get a really nasty superior concave vs an entrenched Terran if you can get sight of the highground, you can always build a pylon too and warp in on the high ground.

entry.title: The Hive • How to not get hacked.
entry.content:
Amara wrote:

connorzerg wrote:
Also, Amara you must be the most honest internet user in the world if you have never needed an anti-virus program for the last ten years, i downloaded a SC2 game from a website and got a virus. (which i reported to battle.net), it was called SCV football and it sounded awesome


lol, I wouldn't say that. I just don't download from sites I don't trust. Places that say their downloads are virus free or sites that people I know have downloaded from before without issue.

I would probably add some points about emails if you want to go the full security hog:
Use trusted/non-free email addresses: There is a reason while things like hotmail/gmail are free and it's not because they love us and think we deserve it. I would say most ISP offer free email addresses with their internet plans or maybe at a cheap price ontop. Use it (as well as your own hosted email address if you trust your hoster/yourself). As more and more game publishers move from usernames to email address logins, your 'username' is now available to any spammer/hacker out there. I use one ISP email address for all the games I play by trustworthy game publishers.
Get a second free/throw away email address, like the one you should have for spam (you know the one, for when your trying to get through a site and it wants an email address), but make this one you don't mind checking for forums/facebook/whatever where it's a little more trustworthy but who gives a hoot if someone gets a hold of it.


yeah i take the spam idea to a bit more i have an email account for everything, e.g. one for spam, one for youtube, facebook, msn, games, forums etc.

entry.title: Starcraft II Discussion • Potential New Ladder maps 1.2.1
entry.content:
Zes wrote:

Achilles wrote:
Ugh, zerg is never going to be able to defend their natural on the one with the blistering sands tileset.



why not? zerg likes open areas to surround. put some spines and u should be good to go.


They like open areas when they're on the offensive, ideally there's a choke leading to your natural and you put spines at THAT. Open natural means they can walk around the spines you have and maneuvering around your natural is far far easier, and it's harder to corner and trap something like a blink stalker rush.
